questions.question:
The set-up of an experiment is shown below. At room temperature, the system initially contains 40 cm3 of N2(g), 23 cm3 of O2(g) and 10 cm3 of He(g).

![](images/Topic10/dse2014-19-1765875618642-inline-q-qimg-1765875583496-9540.png)

The plungers of the gas syringes are moved to and fro until there is no further change in the system. The system is then allowed to cool to room temperature. Which of the following statements concerning the experiment are correct?

(1) Some copper powder would change to a black substance.
(2) The total volume of the gases in the system would decrease by 25 cm3.
(3) The same change in total volume of the gases would be observed if excess copper powder is replaced with excess iron powder.

The concentration-time graph for a certain chemical reaction in a closed vessel of fixed volume is shown below:

![](images/Topic10/dse2012-26-1766553451306-inline-q-qimg-1766553437059-496-mjjlho2c-5684.png)

Which of the following chemical equations correctly represents the reaction?

In a 1 dm<sup>3</sup> closed container, 1 mole of X<sub>2</sub>(g) undergoes decomposition to form X<sub>2</sub>(g) until equilibrium is attained. The chemical equation concerned is shown below:
X<sub>2</sub>(g) ⇌ 2X(g)
Which of the following graphs correctly shows the variation in concentration of X<sub>2</sub>(g) and X(g) with time?

X<sub>2</sub>(g) + 3Y<sub>2</sub>(g) ⇌ 2XY<sub>3</sub>(g)
A mixture of X<sub>2</sub>(g) and Y<sub>2</sub>(g) was introduced into a 2.0 dm<sup>3</sup> closed vessel kept at a fixed temperature. When the system attained equilibrium, the vessel contained 0.4 mol of X<sub>2</sub>(g), 0.3 mol of Y<sub>2</sub>(g) and 0.4 mol of XY<sub>3</sub>(g).
Which of the following is the numerical value of Kc for the above reaction at this temperature?

X<sub>2</sub>(g) + 3Y<sub>2</sub>(g) ⇌ 2XY<sub>3</sub>(g)
A mixture of X<sub>2</sub>(g) and Y<sub>2</sub>(g) was introduced into a 2.0 dm<sup>3</sup> closed vessel kept at a fixed temperature. When the system attained equilibrium, the vessel contained 0.4 mol of X<sub>2</sub>(g), 0.3 mol of Y<sub>2</sub>(g) and 0.4 mol of XY<sub>3</sub>(g).
Which of the following combinations shows the effects of a catalyst on the rate of forward reaction, rate of backward reaction and the yield of XY<sub>3</sub>(g)?
<u>Rate of forward reaction</u>	       <u>Rate of backward reaction</u>        <u>Yield of XY3(g)</u>

Consider the information below:
<u>Reaction</u>				<u>Equilibrium constant at 25℃</u>
A(aq) + B(aq) ⇌ C(aq) + D(aq)			         K<sub>1</sub>
C(aq) + D(aq) ⇌ E(aq) + F(aq) + G(aq)		         K<sub>2</sub>
E(aq) + F(aq) + G(aq) ⇌ A(aq) + B(aq)		         K<sub>3</sub>
Which of the following combinations is correct?
<u>Relationship of K<sub>1</sub>, K<sub>2</sub> and K<sub>3</sub></u>     <u>Unit of K<sub>3</sub></u>

The following system attained equilibrium at a certain temperature
2SO<sub>2</sub>(g) + O<sub>2</sub>(g) ⇌ 2SO<sub>3</sub>(g)
Which of the following statements is/are correct when the volume of the system is decreased while the temperature remains unchanged?
(1) The value of K<sub>c</sub> increases
(2) The equilibrium position shifts to the right
(3) The rate of decomposition of SO<sub>3</sub>(g) increases
1st statement At chemical equilibrium state, the forward reaction rate equals zero 2nd statement At chemical equilibrium state, the reactants would not react to give the products

options.content: Both statements are true and the 2nd statement is a correct explanation of the 1st statement
Both statements are true but the 2nd statement is NOT a correct explanation of the 1st statement
The 1st statement is false but the 2nd statement is true

questions.question:
Consider the following reaction at a certain temperature:
2XY<sub>3</sub>(g) ⇌ X<sub>2</sub>(g) + 2Y<sub>2</sub>(g)		K<sub>c</sub> = 0.60 mol dm<sup>-3</sup>
An equilibrium mixture was obtained at this temperature as shown below:

![](images/Topic10/dse2015-27-1766554894233-inline-q-qimg-1766554882194-99-mjjli0f6-6077.png)

What is n?

In a closed container and at a certain temperature, the following equilibrium was attained:
COCl<sub>2</sub>(g) ⇌ CO(g) + Cl<sub>2</sub>(g)
Which of the following statements is/are correct?
(1) CO(g) and Cl<sub>2</sub>(g) must be of the same concentration
(2) The rate of decomposition of COCl<sub>2</sub>(g) is equal to the rate of formation of CO(g)
(3) The equilibrium constant K<sub>c</sub> for the reaction increases when the volume of the container increases

Consider the following equilibrium reaction system in a closed container of fixed volume:
CO(g) + H<sub>2</sub>O(g) ⇌ CO<sub>2</sub>(g) + H<sub>2</sub>(g)			∆H < 0
Which of the following, when applied to the system, would lead to an increase in the rate of formation of H<sub>2</sub>(g)?
(1) adding CO(g)
(2) increasing the temperature
(3) adding a suitable catalyst

The following reaction has attained equilibrium in a fixed volume container:
CO(g) + H<sub>2</sub>O(g) ⇌ CO<sub>2</sub>(g) + H<sub>2</sub>(g)			∆H = –41.1 kJ mol<sup>-1</sup>
Which of the following is correct if the temperature of the system is increased?

options.content: The pressure of the system remains unchanged
Both the rates of forward and backward reaction increase
The equilibrium constant of the reaction remains unchanged
The respective yields of CO<sub>2</sub>(g) and H<sub>2</sub>(g) increase to the same extent

questions.question:
Consider the following equilibrium system:
Br<sub>2</sub>(aq) + H<sub>2</sub>O(l) ⇌ HOBr(aq) + H<sup>+</sup>(aq) + Br<sup>-</sup>(aq)
Which of the following can turn the colour of the system paler?

W(l) + X(l) ⇌ Y(l) + Z(l)				∆H = +45kJ mol<sup>-1</sup>
At 25℃, the equilibrium constant K<sub>c</sub> for the reaction is 2.5. In an experiment, 1.0 mol of W(l) and 1.0 mol of X(l) are placed in a closed container keeping at 25℃. When equilibrium is attained, the total volume of the reaction mixture is 0.20 dm<sup>3</sup>.
How many moles of Y(l) would be present in the container when equilibrium is attained?

W(l) + X(l) ⇌ Y(l) + Z(l)				∆H = +45kJ mol<sup>-1</sup>
At 25℃, the equilibrium constant Kc for the reaction is 2.5. In an experiment, 1.0 mol of W(l) and 1.0 mol of X(l) are placed in a closed container keeping at 25℃. When equilibrium is attained, the total volume of the reaction mixture is 0.20 dm<sup>3</sup>.
When equilibrium is attained, which of the following would increase the number of moles of Y(l)?
(1) removing Z(l) from the reaction mixture
(2) increasing the volume of the container
(3) increasing the temperature of the reaction mixture

Consider the following equilibrium system:
2CrO<sub>4</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq) + 2H<sup>+</sup>(aq) ⇌ Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq) + H<sub>2</sub>O(l)
Which of the following statements are INCORRECT?
(1) [CrO<sub>4</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq)] must be equal to [Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq)]
(2) Both the forward reaction and the backward reaction have stopped
(3) The number of moles of CrO<sub>4</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq) must be double the number of moles of Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq)

Consider the following equilibrium system in a certain liquid medium at 25℃:
CH<sub>3</sub>COCH<sub>3</sub> + HCN ⇌ (CH<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>C(OH)CN			∆H > 0
Which of the following statements is correct (assuming the total volume of the system remains unchanged)?

options.content: Adding (CH<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>C(OH)CN would increase the equilibrium constant K<sub>c</sub>
Increasing the temperature would increase the concentration of (CH<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>C(OH)CN
The concentration of CH<sub>3</sub>COCH<sub>3</sub> must be equal to the concentration of (CH<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>C(OH)CN
After adding HCN and when a new equilibrium is attained, the concentration of HCN would be restored to the value before the addition of HCN

questions.question:
The equilibrium constant Kc for the reaction N<sub>2</sub>O<sub>4</sub> ⇌ 2NO<sub>2</sub>(g) at 70℃ is 0.13 mol dm<sup>-3</sup>. In a 5.0 dm<sup>3</sup> closed container kept at 70℃, there is a mixture of 0.20 mol of N<sub>2</sub>O<sub>4</sub>(g) and 0.30 mol of NO<sub>2</sub>(g) at a certain moment. Which of the following combinations is correct at that moment?
<u>Reaction quotient Q<sub>c</sub> / mol dm<sup>-3</sup></u>		<u>Rate of the reaction</u>

Consider the following equilibrium system in a closed container of fixed volume:
A(g) + B(g) ⇌ 2C(g)
A small amount of B(g) is added at time t and finally a new equilibrium is attained at the same temperature. Which of the following graphs can represent the variation of [C(g)] with time?

Consider the following two reactions at a certain temperature:
Reaction (1): CO(g) + H<sub>2</sub>O(g) ⇌ CO<sub>2</sub>(g) + H<sub>2</sub>(g)	Equilibrium constant K<sub>c</sub> = 0.8
Reaction (2): CO<sub>2</sub>(g) + H<sub>2</sub>(g) ⇌ CO(g) + H<sub>2</sub>O(g)	Equilibrium constant K<sub>c</sub> = X
What is X?

The decomposition of HI(g) into H<sub>2</sub>(g) and I<sub>2</sub>(g) is reversible. In a closed container of 3.0 dm<sup>3</sup> keeping at a fixed temperature, an equilibrium mixture contains 0.10 mol of HI(g), 0.60 mol of H<sub>2</sub>(g) and 0.60 mol of I<sub>2</sub>(g). What is the equilibrium constant K<sub>c</sub> for the decomposition at this temperature?

Consider the information below:
<u>Reaction</u>			<u>Equilibrium constant at 25℃</u>
H<sub>2</sub>A(aq) ⇌ H<sup>+</sup>(aq) + HA<sup>-</sup>(aq)		1.3 x 10<sup>-3</sup> mol dm<sup>-3</sup>
HA<sup>-</sup>(aq) ⇌ H<sup>+</sup>(aq) + A<sup>2-</sup>(aq)		3.1 x 10<sup>-6</sup> mol dm<sup>-3</sup>
2HA<sup>-</sup>(aq) ⇌ H<sub>2</sub>A(aq) + A<sup>2-</sup>(aq)		X
What is the numerical value of X?

Refer to the following chemical reaction:
H<sub>2</sub>O(l) ⇌ H<sup>+</sup>(aq) + OH<sup>-</sup>(aq)				∆H > 0
The pH of a pure water sample is 7.0 at 25℃. Which of the following statements is/are correct when the sample has been heated to 50℃?
(1) The [OH<sup>-</sup>(aq)] of the sample is 1.0 x 10<sup>-7</sup> mol dm<sup>-3</sup>
(2) The pH of the sample is smaller than 7.0
(3) The sample remains neutral

Consider the following reaction under certain conditions:
2X<sub>3</sub>(g) ⇌ 3X<sub>2</sub>(g)			Kc = 4.0 mol dm<sup>-3</sup>
The reaction quotient is 2.0 mol dm<sup>-3</sup> at a certain moment. Which of the following statements is/are correct?
(1) The reaction quotient is larger than 2.0 mol dm<sup>-3</sup> after a period of time
(2) The backward reaction is faster than the forward reaction at that moment
(3) The concentration of X<sub>2</sub>(g) must be equal to the concentration of X<sub>3</sub>(g) at that moment

Consider the following equilibrium system:

![](images/Topic10/dse2021-32-1766667267160-inline-q-qimg-1766667238360-5450-mjlg4ysv-9941.png)

Which of the following statements is/are correct?
(1) Adding Na<sub>2</sub>CO<sub>3</sub>(s) would make its colour become paler
(2) Increasing the temperature would make its colour become darker
(3) Adding a few drops of concentrated HCl(aq) would increase the concentration of A<sup>-</sup>(aq)

Consider the following equilibrium system:
2CrO<sub>4</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq) + 2H<sup>+</sup>(aq) ⇌ Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq) + H<sub>2</sub>O(l)
Which of the following statements can demonstrate that chromium exhibits the characteristic(s) of transition metals?
(1) Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub><sup>2-</sup>(aq) ions are orange in colour
(2) Adding HCl(aq) would shift the equilibrium position to the right
(3) The oxidation states of chromium in CrO<sub>4</sub><sup>2-</sup> and Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub><sup>2-</sup> are the same

<u>1st statement</u>
At chemical equilibrium, the concentration of reactants must be equal to the concentration of products

<u>2nd statement</u>
At chemical equilibrium, both forward reaction rate and backward reaction rate are equal to zero

options.content: Both statements are true and the 2nd statement is a correct explanation of the 1st statement
Both statements are true but the 2nd statement is NOT a correct explanation of the 1st statement
The 1st statement is false but the 2nd statement is true
